scenarioDescription:
The K2-117 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-117 is a star with 0.54 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.51 times its radius. It is located 331.48 light years away from the solar system.

K2-117 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-117 system


K2-117 b

K2-117 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2017-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-117 b is 4.770 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-117 b is 2.030 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.14, and a semi-major axis of 0.0189 astronomical units, K2-117 b could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.


K2-117 c

K2-117 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2017-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-117 c is 4.897 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-117 c is 2.060 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 3.08, and a semi-major axis of 0.0492 astronomical units, K2-117 c could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-117, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-117 - System With 2 Exolanets
